course_title: Spec Topics:Dance & Mvmnt Studies: Ballet Culture.: Pleasure&Pain
seats: Seats: Maximum Enrollment: 6 / Seats Avail: 1Waitlist Total: 0
class_notes:
This course examines how media simultaneously portrays and constructs cultural representations of ballet through the tropes of pleasure and pain. Students will analyze popular films from the 1940s to present day, documentaries, and television series in relationship to dance history and larger Westernized notions of sexuality, childhood, and the body.


(Same as FILM 385W 1 & WGS 385W 3)
course_description: Course based on selected topics in dance or movement studies. May be repeated for credit when topic varies.
sections: Class Nbr: 2493, Section #: 1, Type: LEC, Campus: ATL, Meets: MW 11:30a-12:45p, Instructor: M. Mandradjieff, Status: Open
